page.title: 09The Coastal Path
page.content: The cliff top footpath in our study area is part of the South West Coastal Path. It is marked clearly with white acorn signs, the Countryside Commission long distance path symbol. This path is managed as part of the national "Heritage Coast" scheme. Near Durlston Bay land becomes more unstable and in 1960 a landslip altered the path considerably. The footpath now passes over the remains of a bungalow that was swept away when the cliff collapsed. From the cliff path colonies of sea birds can be observed nesting. Other wild birds live happily, and useful information signs help expert and amateur alike in their observations.
